Rule.title: Check permission of crontab files

description.xhtml:p: Crontab configuration files and scripts must be only accessable (read, write, execute) by the owner.

To protect the integrity of scheduled system jobs and prevent malicious modification to these jobs, crontab files must be secured. Additionally the crontab files may contain sensitive information (passwords, etc.) that need to be protected from other users.

File(s) affected:
/etc/crontab
/etc/cron.d/*
/etc/cron.daily/*
/etc/cron.hourly/*
/etc/cron.weekly/*
/var/spool/cron/*

Rule.title: Check owner of crontab files

description.xhtml:p: Crontab files and scripts must be owned by root.
To protect the integrity of scheduled system jobs and prevent malicious modification to these jobs, crontab files must be secured.

File(s) affected:
/etc/crontab
/etc/cron.d/*
/etc/cron.daily/*
/etc/cron.hourly/*
/etc/cron.weekly/*
/var/spool/cron/*

Rule.title: Check group-owner of crontab files

description.xhtml:p: Crontab files and scripts must be group-owned by root.
To protect the integrity of scheduled system jobs and prevent malicious modification to these jobs, crontab files must be secured.

File(s) affected:
/etc/crontab
/etc/cron.d/*
/etc/cron.daily/*
/etc/cron.hourly/*
/etc/cron.weekly/*
/var/spool/cron/*

Rule.title: Check permissions of crontab directories

description.xhtml:p: Crontab directories must not be writable by users other than the owner.
To protect the integrity of scheduled system jobs and to prevent malicious addition of jobs, crontab directories must be secured.

File(s) affected:
/etc/cron.d/*
/etc/cron.daily/*
/etc/cron.hourly/*
/etc/cron.weekly/*
/var/spool/cron/*

Rule.title: Check owner of crontab directories.

description.xhtml:p: Crontab directories must be owned by root.

Incorrect ownership of the cron or crontab directories could permit unauthorized users the ability to alter or add cron jobs and run automated jobs as privileged users. Failure to give ownership of cron or crontab directories to root or to bin provides the designated owner and unauthorized users with the potential to access sensitive information or change the system configuration which could weaken the system's security posture.

File(s) affected:
/etc/cron.d/*
/etc/cron.daily/*
/etc/cron.hourly/*
/etc/cron.weekly/*
/var/spool/cron/*

Rule.title: Check group-owner of crontab directories.

description.xhtml:p: Crontab directories must be group root.

To protect the integrity of scheduled system jobs and to prevent malicious modification of these jobs, crontab files must be secured. Failure to give group-ownership of cron or crontab directories to a system group provides the designated group and unauthorized users with the potential to access sensitive information or change the system configuration which could weaken the system's security posture.

File(s) affected:
/etc/cron.d/*
/etc/cron.daily/*
/etc/cron.hourly/*
/etc/cron.weekly/*
/var/spool/cron/*

Rule.title: Check if the shell used to execute crontab jobs is set correctly.

description.xhtml:p: The shell should be set to /bin/bash in the crontab configuration file.
Having a non-standard shell used for executing the commands in the crontab may cause unintended consequences.

File(s) affected:
/etc/crontab

Rule.title: Check if the PATH variable in crontab is set correctly.

description.xhtml:p: The PATH variable in the crontab configuration file must contain only /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin and /usr/sbin.
Additional paths in the PATH value may allow other users to influence the execution of a scheduled job through replacing the used shell.

File(s) affected:
/etc/crontab
